title: Infernal Affairs
simple_desc: A story between a mole in the police department and an undercover cop. Their objectives are the same: to find out who is the mole, and who is the cop.

title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
simple_desc: A distant poor relative of the Duke D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

title: Touch of Evil
simple_desc: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

title: Le Samouraï
simple_desc: After professional hitman Jef Costello is seen by witnesses his efforts to provide himself an alibi drive him further into a corner.

title: Elite Squad

title: Haider

title: Black Cat, White Cat

title: Elite Squad 2: The Enemy Within
simple_desc: After a prison riot, former-Captain Nascimento, now a high ranking security officer in Rio de Janeiro, is swept into a bloody political dispute that involves government officials and paramilitary groups.

title: A Short Film About Killing
simple_desc: A soon-to-be lawyer crosses his path with a taxi driver and a young sinister man.

title: Special 26
simple_desc: A gang of con-men rob prominent rich businessmen and politicians by posing as C.B.I and income tax officers.

title: Knives Out
simple_desc: A detective investigates the death of the patriarch of an eccentric, combative family.

title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
simple_desc: An urbane fox cannot resist returning to his farm raiding ways and then must help his community survive the farmers' retaliation.

title: True Romance
simple_desc: In Detroit, a lonely pop culture geek marries a call girl, steals cocaine from her pimp, and tries to sell it in Hollywood. Meanwhile, the owners of the cocaine, the Mob, track them down in an attempt to reclaim it.

title: In Bruges
simple_desc: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.

title: Mystic River
simple_desc: The lives of three men who were childhood friends are shattered when one of them has a family tragedy.

title: The Big Sleep
simple_desc: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a wealthy family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail and what might be love.

title: The Blues Brothers

title: Carlito's Way

title: Ghost in the Shell
simple_desc: A cyborg policewoman and her partner hunt a mysterious and powerful hacker called the Puppet Master.

title: Bound by Honor
simple_desc: Based on the true life experiences of poet Jimmy Santiago Baca, the film focuses on step-brothers Paco and Cruz, and their bi-racial cousin Miklo.

title: Shoplifters

title: Dancer in the Dark
simple_desc: An Eastern European US immigrant with a love for musicals has to cope with the gradual loss of her vision.

title: Once Were Warriors
simple_desc: A family descended from Maori warriors is bedeviled by a violent father and the societal problems of being treated as outcasts.

title: Rope
simple_desc: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.

title: The Killing
simple_desc: Crook Johnny Clay assembles a five-man team to plan and execute a daring racetrack robbery.

title: Mildred Pierce
simple_desc: A hard-working mother inches towards disaster as she divorces her husband and starts a successful restaurant business to support her spoiled daughter.

title: Strangers on a Train
simple_desc: A psychopath forces a tennis star to comply with his theory that two strangers can get away with murder.

title: Arsenic and Old Lace
simple_desc: A Brooklyn writer of books on the futility of marriage risks his reputation when he decides to tie the knot. Things get even more complicated when he learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are habitual murderers.

title: In Cold Blood

title: The Thin Man

title: Ugly
simple_desc: The case of a missing girl takes us through a journey of human greed and brushes upon the egos and repressed emotions of the characters.

title: Elevator to the Gallows

title: 3-Iron
simple_desc: A transient young man breaks into empty homes to partake of the vacationing residents' lives for a few days.

title: Nine Queens

title: The Red Circle
simple_desc: After leaving prison, master thief Corey crosses paths with a notorious escapee and an alcoholic former policeman. The trio proceed to plot an elaborate heist.

title: The Big Heat

title: The Best of Youth

Two high school sweethearts meet at a reunion after 22 years and reminisce about their past.

title: Anbe Sivam

title: Apocalypse Now

April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

title: La haine

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
simple_desc: Concurrent theatrical ending of the TV series Neon Genesis Evangelion (1995).

title: PK

title: The 400 Blows

title: Inherit the Wind

Thanks to his fractured state of mind and her vivid imagination, the line between fiction and reality blurs as the tale advances.

simple_desc: A hard-working mother inches towards disaster as she divorces her husband and starts a successful restaurant business to support her spoiled daughter.

title: Strangers on a Train
simple_desc: A psychopath forces a tennis star to comply with his theory that two strangers can get away with murder.

title: Laura
simple_desc: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

title: The Lost Weekend
simple_desc: The desperate life of a chronic alcoholic is followed through a four-day drinking bout.

title: In a Lonely Place
simple_desc: A potentially violent screenwriter is a murder suspect until his lovely neighbor clears him. However, she soon starts to have her doubts.

title: The Big Heat
simple_desc: Tough cop Dave Bannion takes on a politically powerful crime syndicate.

title: Angels with Dirty Faces
simple_desc: A priest tries to stop a gangster from corrupting a group of street kids.

title: To Have and Have Not
simple_desc: During World War II, American expatriate Harry Morgan helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.

title: Shadow of a Doubt
simple_desc: A teenage girl, overjoyed when her favorite uncle comes to visit the family in their quiet California town, slowly begins to suspect that he is in fact the "Merry Widow" killer sought by the authorities.

title: The Asphalt Jungle
simple_desc: A major heist goes off as planned, but then double crosses, bad luck and solid police work cause everything to unravel.

title: Key Largo
simple_desc: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.

title: Scarface
simple_desc: An ambitious and nearly insane violent gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weaknesses prove to be his downfall.

title: The Killers
simple_desc: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and investigator Reardon uncovers his past involvement with beautiful, deadly Kitty Collins.

title: Gilda
simple_desc: A small-time gambler hired to work in a Buenos Aires casino discovers his employer's new wife is his former lover.

title: Spellbound
simple_desc: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

title: Dark Passage
simple_desc: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a woman to try to prove his innocence.

title: The Lady from Shanghai
simple_desc: Fascinated by gorgeous Mrs. Bannister, seaman Michael O'Hara joins a bizarre yachting cruise, and ends up mired in a complex murder plot.

title: Kiss Me Deadly
simple_desc: A doomed female hitchhiker pulls Mike Hammer into a deadly whirlpool of intrigue, revolving around a mysterious "great whatsit".

title: The Wrong Man
simple_desc: In 1953, an innocent man named Christopher Emanuel "Manny" Balestrero is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber.

title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
simple_desc: A married woman and a drifter fall in love, then plot to murder her husband.

title: Suspicion
simple_desc: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, and soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

title: The Stranger
simple_desc: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

title: Killer's Kiss
simple_desc: Ready to catch a train to his hometown, a washed-up boxer tells us about the strange and twisty events that happened to him the past couple of days.

title: Hamilton
simple_desc: The real life of one of America's foremost founding fathers and first Secretary of the Treasury, Alexander Hamilton. Captured live on Broadway from the Richard Rodgers Theater with the original Broadway cast.

title: Sardar Udham
simple_desc: A biopic detailing the 2 decades that Punjabi Sikh revolutionary Udham Singh spent planning the assassination of the man responsible for the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

title: Black Friday
simple_desc: A film about the investigations following the 1993 serial Bombay bomb blasts, told through the different stories of the people involved --police, conspirators, victims, middlemen.

title: Braveheart
simple_desc: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

title: Downfall
simple_desc: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

title: The Great Escape
simple_desc: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

title: Uri: The Surgical Strike
simple_desc: Indian army special forces execute a covert operation, avenging the killing of fellow army men at their base by a terrorist group.

title: The Passion of Joan of Arc
simple_desc: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

title: Hacksaw Ridge

title: 12 Years a Slave

title: Hotel Rwanda
simple_desc: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

title: Inherit the Wind
simple_desc: Based on a real-life case in 1925, two great lawyers argue the case for and against a Tennessee science teacher accused of the crime of teaching evolution.

title: Andrei Rublev

title: The Message
simple_desc: This epic historical drama chronicles the life and times of Prophet Muhammad and serves as an introduction to early Islamic history.

title: JFK
simple_desc: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.

title: Ip Man

title: The King's Speech

title: Gandhi
simple_desc: The life of the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.

title: The Leopard

title: Persepolis

title: All the President's Men

title: Spartacus

title: The Ten Commandments
simple_desc: Moses, raised as a prince of Egypt in the Pharaoh's household, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people from slavery.

title: Letters from Iwo Jima
simple_desc: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.

title: Togo
simple_desc: The story of Togo, the sled dog who led the 1925 serum run despite being considered too small and weak to lead such an intense race.

title: A Taxi Driver

title: In Cold Blood
simple_desc: Two ex-cons murder a family in a robbery attempt, before going on the run from the authorities. The police try to piece together the details of the murder in an attempt to track down the killers.

title: Kagemusha

title: Battleship Potemkin
simple_desc: In the midst of the Russian Revolution of 1905, the crew of the battleship Potemkin mutiny against the brutal, tyrannical regime of the vessel's officers. The resulting street demonstration in Odessa brings on a police massacre.

title: Airlift
simple_desc: When Iraq invades Kuwait in August 1990, a callous Indian businessman becomes the spokesperson for more than 170,000 stranded countrymen.

title: Tombstone
simple_desc: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

title: Hidden Figures

title: Dunkirk

title: The Big Short

title: The Right Stuff
simple_desc: The U.S. space program's development from the breaking of the sound barrier to selection of the Mercury 7 astronauts, from a group of test pilots with a more seat-of-the-pants approach than the program's more cautious engineers preferred.

title: Glory

title: Straight Outta Compton

title: Pride

title: Changeling

title: The Killing Fields

title: Land of Mine

title: Aguirre, the Wrath of God
simple_desc: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.

title: Black Hawk Down

title: The Trial of the Chicago 7
simple_desc: The story of 7 people on trial stemming from various charges surrounding the uprising at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: The Longest Day
simple_desc: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

title: Apollo 13

title: Malcolm X

title: The Last Emperor
simple_desc: Bernardo Bertolucci's Oscar-winning dramatisation of the life story of China's last emperor, Pu Yi.

title: Zulu
simple_desc: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.
The epic tale of a class struggle in twentieth-century Italy as seen through the eyes of two childhood friends on opposing sides.

title: A Man for All Seasons
simple_desc: The story of Sir Thomas More, who stood up to King Henry VIII when the King rejected the Roman Catholic Church to obtain a divorce and remarry.

title: Frost/Nixon
simple_desc: A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.

title: Missing
simple_desc: When an idealistic American writer disappears during the Chilean coup d'état in September 1973, his wife and father try to find him.

title: Joyeux Noel
simple_desc: In December 1914, an unofficial Christmas truce on the Western Front allows soldiers from opposing sides of the First World War to gain insight into each other's way of life.

title: The Thin Red Line
simple_desc: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

title: Bridge of Spies
simple_desc: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

title: Dark Waters
simple_desc: A corporate defense attorney takes on an environmental lawsuit against a chemical company that exposes a lengthy history of pollution.

title: Gettysburg
simple_desc: In 1863, the Northern and Southern forces fight at Gettysburg in the decisive battle of the American Civil War.

title: Hotel Mumbai
simple_desc: The true story of the Taj Hotel terrorist attack in Mumbai. Hotel staff risk their lives to keep everyone safe as people make unthinkable sacrifices to protect themselves and their families.

title: Argentina, 1985
simple_desc: A team of lawyers takes on the heads of Argentina's bloody military dictatorship during the 1980s in a battle against odds and a race against time.

title: The Last King of Scotland
simple_desc: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

title: The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind
simple_desc: Against all the odds, a thirteen-year-old boy in Malawi invents an unconventional way to save his family and village from famine.

title: United 93
simple_desc: A real-time account of the events on United Flight 93, one of the planes hijacked on September 11th, 2001 that crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania when passengers foiled the terrorist plot.

title: Mutiny on the Bounty

title: Bloody Sunday
simple_desc: A dramatization of the Irish civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.

title: Sophie Scholl: The Final Days
simple_desc: A dramatization of the final days of Sophie Scholl, one of the most famous members of the German World War II anti-Nazi resistance movement, The White Rose.

title: Parmanu: The Story of Pokhran
simple_desc: Ashwat Raina and his teammates arrive in Pokhran to re-conduct a confidential nuclear test, where they face challenges from the American Lacrosse satellite and local spies.

title: The Favourite
simple_desc: In early 18th-century England, the status quo at the court is upset when a new servant arrives and endears herself to a frail Queen Anne.

title: The Impossible
simple_desc: The story of a tourist family in Thailand caught in the destruction and chaotic aftermath of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami.

title: Munich

title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
simple_desc: The story of the 1941 Japanese air raid on Pearl Harbor, and the series of preceding American blunders that aggravated its effectiveness.

title: Lust, Caution
simple_desc: During World War II era, a young woman, Wang Jiazhi, gets swept up in a dangerous game of emotional intrigue with a powerful political figure, Mr. Yee.

title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
simple_desc: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

title: Milk

title: Selma
simple_desc: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.

title: Ip Man 2
simple_desc: Centering on Ip Man's migration to Hong Kong in 1949 as he attempts to propagate his discipline of Wing Chun martial arts.

title: A Royal Affair
simple_desc: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

title: Quiz Show
simple_desc: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.

title: The Flowers of War
simple_desc: An American finds refuge during the 1937 Japanese invasion of Nanking in a church with a group of women. Posing as a priest, he attempts to lead the women to safety.

title: Henry V
simple_desc: In the midst of the Hundred Years War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

title: Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior

title: Jodhaa Akbar
simple_desc: A sixteenth century love story about a marriage of alliance that gave birth to true love between a great Mughal emperor, Akbar, and a Rajput princess, Jodha.

title: Zero Dark Thirty
simple_desc: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.

title: A Bridge Too Far

title: Judas and the Black Messiah
simple_desc: Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton.

title: Miracle
simple_desc: The true story of Herb Brooks, the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Soviet squad.

title: The Mission

title: Elizabeth
simple_desc: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
simple_desc: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

title: Gallipoli
simple_desc: Two Australian sprinters face the brutal realities of war when they are sent to fight in the Gallipoli campaign in Turkey during World War I.

title: Rurouni Kenshin Part I: Origins
simple_desc: A former assassin who has resolved to never kill again has his vow sorely tested.

title: Mission Majnu
simple_desc: In the 1970s, an undercover Indian spy takes on a deadly mission to expose a covert nuclear weapons program in the heart of Pakistan.

title: Salvador
simple_desc: A burnt-out photojournalist becomes involved in a Central American revolution.

title: Amazing Grace
simple_desc: The idealist William Wilberforce (Ioan Gruffudd) maneuvers his way through Parliament, endeavoring to end the British transatlantic slave trade.

title: No
simple_desc: An advertising executive comes up with a campaign to defeat Augusto Pinochet in Chile's 1988 referendum.

title: Kesari
simple_desc: Based on an incredible true story of the Battle of Saragarhi in which an army of 21 Sikhs fought against 10,000 Afghans in 1897.

title: The King
simple_desc: Hal, wayward prince and heir to the English throne, is crowned King Henry V after his tyrannical father dies. Now the young king must navigate palace politics, the war his father left behind, and the emotional strings of his past life.

title: 13 Hours
simple_desc: During an attack on a U.S. compound in Libya, a security team struggles to make sense out of the chaos.

title: Patriots Day
simple_desc: The story of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing and the aftermath, which includes the city-wide manhunt to find the terrorists responsible.

title: Lincoln
simple_desc: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

title: First Man
simple_desc: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

title: Across the Universe
simple_desc: The music of The Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.

title: Amistad
simple_desc: In 1839, the revolt of Mende captives aboard a Spanish owned ship causes a major controversy in the United States when the ship is captured off the coast of Long Island. The courts must decide whether the Mende are slaves or legally free.

title: The Way Back
simple_desc: Siberian gulag escapees travel four thousand miles by foot to freedom in India.

title: Invictus
simple_desc: Nelson Mandela, in his first term as President of South Africa, initiates a unique venture to unite the Apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

title: Little Boy
simple_desc: An eight-year-old boy is willing to do whatever it takes to end World War II so he can bring his father home. The story reveals the indescribable love a father has for his little boy and the love a son has for his father.

title: Capote
simple_desc: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.

title: Seabiscuit
simple_desc: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

title: The Walk
simple_desc: In 1974, high-wire artist Philippe Petit recruits a team of people to help him realize his dream: to walk the immense void between the World Trade Center towers.

title: Detroit
simple_desc: Fact-based drama set during the 1967 Detroit riots in which a group of rogue police officers respond to a complaint with retribution rather than justice on their minds.

title: Jesus Christ Superstar
simple_desc: Film version of the musical stage play, presenting the last few weeks of Christ's life told in an anachronistic manner.

title: Thirteen Days
simple_desc: In October 1962, the Kennedy administration struggles to contain the Cuban Missile Crisis.

title: Woman in Gold
simple_desc: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

title: Eddie the Eagle
simple_desc: The story of Eddie Edwards, the notoriously tenacious British underdog ski jumper who charmed the world at the 1988 Winter Olympics.

title: Reds
simple_desc: A radical American journalist becomes involved with the Communist revolution in Russia, and hopes to bring its spirit and idealism to the United States.

title: The 12th Man
simple_desc: They were 12 saboteurs. The Nazis killed 11 of them. This is the true story of the one that got away.

title: Red Cliff
simple_desc: The first chapter of a two-part story centered on a battle fought in China's Three Kingdoms period (220-280 A.D.).

title: Marshall
simple_desc: The story of Thurgood Marshall, the crusading lawyer who would become the first African-American Supreme Court Justice, as he battles through one of his career-defining cases.

title: The Baader Meinhof Complex
simple_desc: A look at Germany's terrorist group, The Red Army Faction (RAF), which organized bombings, robberies, kidnappings, and assassinations in the late 1960s and '70s.

title: Max Manus: Man of War
simple_desc: The true story about one of the most brilliant saboteurs during World War II and his battle to overcome his inner demons.

title: Babylon
simple_desc: A tale of outsized ambition and outrageous excess, it traces the rise and fall of multiple characters during an era of unbridled decadence and depravity in early Hollywood.

title: She Said
simple_desc: New York Times reporters Megan Twohey and Jodi Kantor break one of the most important stories in a generation - a story that helped ignite a movement and shattered decades of silence around the subject of sexual assault in Hollywood.

title: The Patriot
simple_desc: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

title: Kingdom of Heaven
simple_desc: Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the Crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people.

title: The Death of Stalin
simple_desc: Moscow, 1953. After being in power for nearly 30 years, Soviet dictator Joseph Vissarionovich Stalin takes ill and quickly dies. Now the members of the Council of Ministers scramble for power.

title: The Young Victoria
simple_desc: A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.

title: The Courier
simple_desc: Businessman Greville Wynne is asked by a Russian source to try to help put an end to the Cuban Missile Crisis.

title: The Post
simple_desc: A cover-up spanning four U.S. Presidents pushes the country's first female newspaper publisher and her editor to join an unprecedented battle between press and government.

title: Anthropoid
simple_desc: Based on the extraordinary true story of Operation Anthropoid, the WWII mission to assassinate SS General Reinhard Heydrich, the main architect behind the Final Solution and the Reich's third in command after Hitler and Himmler.

title: The Report
simple_desc: Idealistic Senate staffer Daniel J. Jones, tasked by his boss to lead an investigation into the CIA's post 9/11 Detention and Interrogation Program, uncovers shocking secrets.

title: War Horse
simple_desc: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.

title: The Professor and the Madman
simple_desc: Professor James Murray begins work compiling words for the first edition of the Oxford English Dictionary in the mid-19th century, and receives over 10,000 entries from a patient at Broadmoor Criminal Lunatic Asylum, Dr. William Minor.

title: Secretariat
simple_desc: Penny Chenery Tweedy and colleagues guide her long-shot but precocious stallion to set, in 1973, the unbeaten record for winning the Triple Crown.

title: Stan & Ollie
simple_desc: Laurel and Hardy, the world's most famous comedy duo, attempt to reignite their film careers as they embark on what becomes their swan song: a grueling theatre tour of post-war Britain.

title: The Siege of Jadotville
simple_desc: Irish Commandant Pat Quinlan leads a stand off with troops against French and Belgian Mercenaries in the Congo during the early 1960s.

title: Bajirao Mastani
simple_desc: An account of the romance between the Maratha general, Baji Rao I and Mastani, princess of Bundelkhand.

title: Testament of Youth
simple_desc: A British woman recalls coming of age during World War I - a story of young love, the futility of war, and how to make sense of the darkest times.

title: Eight Men Out
simple_desc: A dramatization of the Black Sox scandal when the underpaid Chicago White Sox accepted bribes to deliberately lose the 1919 World Series.

title: The Physician
simple_desc: In 11th-century Persia, a surgeon's apprentice disguises himself as a Jew to study at a school that does not admit Christians.

title: Che: Part One
simple_desc: In 1956, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara and a band of Castro-led Cuban exiles mobilize an army to topple the regime of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

title: Russian Ark
simple_desc: A 19th century French aristocrat, notorious for his scathing memoirs about life in Russia, travels through the Russian State Hermitage Museum and encounters historical figures from the last 200+ years.

title: Mongol: The Rise of Genghis Khan
simple_desc: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world in 1206.

title: Silence
simple_desc: In the 17th century, two Portuguese Jesuit priests travel to Japan in an attempt to locate their mentor, who is rumored to have committed apostasy, and to propagate Catholicism.

title: We Were Soldiers
simple_desc: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it, while their wives wait nervously and anxiously at home for the good news or the bad news.

title: Deepwater Horizon
